original_theorem: Prove that for any $a, b, c$ which are the lengths of the sides of a triangle, the following inequality holds:\n$$ (a+b-c)^{a}(b+c-a)^{b}(c+a-b)^{c} \leq a^{a} b^{b} c^{c} $$
theorem_translation:
```lean4
theorem triangle_inequality_power_sum (a b c : ℝ) (h_a : 0 < a) (h_b : 0 < b) (h_c : 0 < c)
    (h_triangle : a + b > c ∧ a + c > b ∧ b + c > a) :
    (a + b - c) ^ a * (b + c - a) ^ b * (c + a - b) ^ c ≤ a ^ a * b ^ b * c ^ c := by
```

attempt_history.verified_code:
import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem triangle_inequality_power_sum (a b c : ℝ) (h_a : 0 < a) (h_b : 0 < b) (h_c : 0 < c)
    (h_triangle : a + b > c ∧ a + c > b ∧ b + c > a) :
    (a + b - c) ^ a * (b + c - a) ^ b * (c + a - b) ^ c ≤ a ^ a * b ^ b * c ^ c := by sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
• $a, b, c$ are the lengths of the sides of a triangle, with $a+b>c$, $b+c>a$, and $c+a>b$ [tc_1].
• Let $x = a+b-c$, $y = b+c-a$, and $z = c+a-b$ [def_1].
Therefore, we conclude:
• $x, y, z$ are all positive, i.e., $x>0, y>0, z>0$ [l1].
proof_steps.lean_tactics:
let x := a + b - c
  let y := b + c - a
  let z := c + a - b
  have l1 : x > 0 ∧ y > 0 ∧ z > 0 := by
    constructor
    . exact sub_pos.mpr h_triangle.left
    constructor
    . exact sub_pos.mpr h_triangle.right.right
    . exact sub_pos.mpr h_triangle.right.left

import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem triangle_inequality_power_sum (a b c : ℝ) (h_a : 0 < a) (h_b : 0 < b) (h_c : 0 < c)
    (h_triangle : a + b > c ∧ a + c > b ∧ b + c > a) :
    (a + b - c) ^ a * (b + c - a) ^ b * (c + a - b) ^ c ≤ a ^ a * b ^ b * c ^ c := by
  let x := a + b - c
  let y := b + c - a
  let z := c + a - b
  have l1 : x > 0 ∧ y > 0 ∧ z > 0 := by
    constructor
    . exact sub_pos.mpr h_triangle.left
    constructor
    . exact sub_pos.mpr h_triangle.right.right
    . exact sub_pos.mpr h_triangle.right.left

import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem triangle_inequality_power_sum (a b c : ℝ) (h_a : 0 < a) (h_b : 0 < b) (h_c : 0 < c)
    (h_triangle : a + b > c ∧ a + c > b ∧ b + c > a) :

  let y := b + c - a
  let z := c + a - b

    constructor
